1.rationale:
Considering the current board state, our snake’s head is now at (2,4) while our tail sits at (2,3). The available apple positions are at (9,8), (2,7), (0,5), (9,0), and (5,3).

Looking at the options from (2,4):

• Moving UP would take us to (2,5), which might seem to lead toward apple (2,7), but enemy snake #2 occupies (2,6) (its body segment), so that vertical path is blocked.

• Moving RIGHT would head us toward the apple at (5,3), but that is 4 moves away, and it’s better to go for a closer target if possible.

• Moving LEFT takes us to (1,4). Although it isn’t an apple immediately, it brings us closer to the apple at (0,5). From (2,4), reaching (0,5) can be planned using a short three–move path (LEFT → UP → LEFT).

• Moving DOWN would head toward our own tail at (2,3), which is risky (and in many snake games you can’t simply reverse onto yourself).

There are no obstacles in (1,4), so our safest and most promising plan is to move LEFT and work our way toward apple (0,5).

Next move: LEFT.
